705324f.title: Brooklyn: Kingston Avenue - Rutland Road
705324f.text:
Kingston Avenue, east side, from Rutland Road to Feni-
more Street, showing one of the units of the Kingston Avenue
Hospital, where the W. P. A. is conducting improvement oper-
ations. This building is located on the south side of Rut-
land Road, near Albany Avenue.
January 11, 1937
Works Progress Administration
City Wide Project
CPEDIT LINE IMPERATIVE
705324f.folder: Kingston Avenue & Rutland Road, Brooklyn, NY

705316f-a.title: Brooklyn: Kingston Avenue - Rutland Road
705316f-a.text:
Eingston Avenue, east side, from Rutland Road to
Fanimore Street. Shown is one of the units of the Eingston
Avenue Hospital, which the Works Progress Administration
is altering and moderniying (see later view). The build-
ing is situated on the south side of Rutland Road, at
Albany Avenue.
June 6, 1936
Photo by Federal Art Project--W. P. A.
Photographio Division
CREDIT LINP IPERATIVE
705316f-a.folder: Kingston Avenue & Rutland Road, Brooklyn, NY

705315f-a.title: Brooklyn: Kingston Avenue - Rutland Road
705315f-a.text:
Kingston Avenue, east side, from Rutland Avenue to
Fenimore Street, showing one of the wings of the main
building of the Kingston Avenue Hospital. The Works Progress
Administration is conducting extensiwe improvement opera-
tions here, on the buildings and the grounds.
July 6, 1936
Federal Art Project--W. P. A.
Photographic Division
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE
705315f-a.folder: Kingston Avenue & Rutland Road, Brooklyn, NY

705322f.title: Brooklyn: Kingston Avenue - Rutland Road
705322f.text:
Eingston Avenue, east side, from Rutland Road to Feni-
more Street, showing part of the grounds of the Kingston Ave.
Hospital and improvement operations being condocted by the
Works Progsess Administration. The building with the ''O,,t''
sign is the dispensary. The houses to the right of it are
private residences on the north side of Rutland Road.
January 11, 1937
Works Progress Administration
City Wide Project
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE
705322f.folder: Kingston Avenue & Rutland Road, Brooklyn, NY

705325f-a.title: Brooklyn: Kingston Avenue - Rutland Road
705325f-a.text:
Eingston Avenue, east side, from Rutland Road to Feni-
more Street, showing part of the grounds and units of the
Kingston Avenue Hospital. The Works Progress Admfnistration
is conducting extensive improvement operations here.
March 10, 1937
Works Progress Administration
City Wide Project
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE
705325f-a.folder: Kingston Avenue & Rutland Road, Brooklyn, NY

705323f-a.title: Brooklyn: Kingston Avenue - Rutland Road
705323f-a.text:
Kingston Avenue, east side, from Rutland Road to Fenimore
Street, showing part of the Kingston Avenue Hospital grounds,
where the Works Progress Administration is conducting a pro-
ject. The buildings in the background are part of Kings County
Hospital. The Kingston Avenue Hospital is bounded by Kingston
and Albany Avenues and by Rutland Road and Fenimore Street.
January 11, 1937
Works Progress Administration
City Wide Project
CREDIT LINE IRPERATIVE
705323f-a.folder: Kingston Avenue & Rutland Road, Brooklyn, NY

705320f-a.title: Brooklyn: Kingston Avenue - Rutland Road
705320f-a.text:
Kingston Avenue, east side, from Rutland Road to Feni-
more Street, showing a small building which the W. P. A.
erected on the grounds of the Kingston Avenue Hospital.
March 10, 1937
Works Progress Administration
City Wide Project
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE
705320f-a.folder: Kingston Avenue & Rutland Road, Brooklyn, NY

705319f-a.text:
Kingston Avenue, east side, from Rutland-6E  22:o Feni-
more Street, showing part of the grounds of the Kingston Ave.
Hospital, where the W. P. A. is conducting a project.
March 10, 1937

705321f-a.title: Brooklyn: Kingston Avenue - Rutland Road
705321f-a.text:
Kingston Avenue, east side, from Rutland Road to Fenimore
Street. Shown are W. P. A. laborers working on a project on
the grounds of the Kingston Avenue Hospital. In the background
is Kings County Hospital, which adjoins the Kingston Avenue
Hospital on the south.
January 11, 1937
Works Progress Administration
City wide Project
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE
705321f-a.folder: Kingston Avenue & Rutland Road, Brooklyn, NY

705318f-a.title: Brooklyn: Kingston Avenue - Rutland Road
705318f-a.text:
Kingston Avenue, east side, from Rutland Road to Fenimore
Street, showing the rear of the main building of the Kingston
Avenue Hospital. W. P. A. workmen are showS conducting an
improvement project here.
January 11, 1937
Works Progress Administration
City Wide Project
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE

Eingston Avenue, east side, from Rutland Road to Fenimore
Street, showing the main building od the Kingston Awenue Hos-
pital.

706539f-a.text:
